intro: Plethiandra, commonly known as the orchid vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and the presence of showy, often fragrant flowers. The plants typically have elongated stems and are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa. Plethiandra species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Their botanical significance lies in their ornamental value and ecological role in supporting diverse pollinator species.
